result.execSummary:
The defendant Neil Fredrick Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other jail sentences.
Concurrent with: Douglas County cases 19CF543, 20CF46, and 20CF96.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Neil Fredrick Miller

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
10:41 AM Defendant Neil Fredrick Miller in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Neil Fredrick Miller.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement. Defendant will plea to the sole count. Sentence of 9 month jail imposed and stayed for 1 year of probation. Probation will be concurrent to Douglas County cases 19CF534, 20CF46, and 20CF96. If revoked, jail sentence will be consecutive to any other jail sentences. 0 days credit in this case. Payment of court costs. 
Defendant pleads no contest to the sole count. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's pleas and finds that the pleas have been freely and voluntarily made. Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders a sentence of 9 months jail imposed and stayed in favor of 1 year of probation. If revoked, jail sentence will be consecutive to any other jail sentences. Probation will be concurrent to Douglas County cases 19CF534, 20CF46, and 20CF96. Conditions of probation include payment of court costs and DOC programming. Bail will be applied to financial balance.

11:10 AM Defendant Neil Fredrick Miller in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Neil Fredrick Miller.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman notes that there has not been an offer made. Would like another status with a quick turnaround.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Neil Fredrick Miller
Current: 334 N 61st Ave W, Duluth, MN 55807 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2022)
Prior: 1518 E 4Th St, Superior, WI 54880

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:41 PM Defendant Neil Fredrick Miller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Hoffman present with defendant. Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Court notes fail to appear at status in May. Court quashes warrant based on appearance. Address updated. Indicates was in treatment on court date. 
State indicates on $500 cash prior. Requests $1000 cash, with prior conditions to continue. Currently on probation in Douglas county. 
Attorney Hoffman indicates lifelong resident of Douglas County until recently. Limited income. No money to post.
Court reviews minutes from initial hearing. Court notes may be in absconder status. Court orders 500 cash, with conditions of no use or possession of controlled substances or paraphernalia without valid prescription.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
11:17 AM Defendant Neil Fredrick Miller not in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Neil Fredrick Miller.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Court indicates notice signed. Court attempts to reach defendant via telephone, voice mail left. State requests warrant and forfeiture, Douglas, adjacent and Ashland.
Court orders warrant and forfeiture.

11:20 AM Defendant Neil Fredrick Miller in court with attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading, enter plea of not guilty. Court accepts the plea of not guilty. State does not object to setting a Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

02:02 PM Defendant Neil Fredrick Miller in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Neil Fredrick Miller in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant would like Mr. Hoffman here who would be willing to make a special appearance today. Defendant would like Atty Hoffman to make appearance on his behalf as he is confident he does qualify. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading and ask for Preliminary Hearing. Court will set the matter for Preliminary hearing.  States request on bail: $500 cash bond no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Last failure to appear was 2011 reappeared in 2016. There have been cases since 2016. It appears there has been a number of them. In the  2020 file defendant did have a failure to appear, did appear unvoluntarily.
Atty Hoffman questions defendant for the purposes of bail. Defendant is a life-long resident. Defendant is not employeed as he is on disability. Defendant is on probation and assumes he is on a hold.Defendant requests bail at $300 and can post that much. 
Court Orders $500 cash bond with conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
